data.event: Off-duty officers from three agencies were called in early Saturday to break up a Chiefland bar brawl that turned into a street fight involving as many as 200 people.
Chiefland Police Chief Robert Douglas said his officers were called to Knuckleheadâ€™s Bar at about 1:30 a.m. Saturday to break up a fight that had moved to the parking lot.

event.title: characterized the participants as mostly men in the 20s

data.event: He characterized the participants as mostly men in the 20s and 30s, with most from the Chiefland or Cross City areas.

event.title: had not been established by Monday morning

data.event: A motive for the fighting had not been established by Monday morning.
